I've also tested setting the clipboard manually from tkinter to test the theory that it's due to `\r` or `\r\n`, but I don't get a crash on either. Here's the code to set the clipboard from Tkinter in IPython:

``` python
from tkinter import Tk
r = Tk()
r.withdraw()
r.clipboard_clear()
r.clipboard_append('[1,2,\r\n3,4]')
%gui tk
```

No, I meant `\r`, we figured out that somewhere inside of IPython, the "pasted string" would be in the case of @bnaul , in IPython: `('a',\r'b')`,  while a pure python shell was seeing `('a',\r\n'b')`

Hi all,

I found this bug.
In Pygments, Lexer.get_tokens replaces both \r\n and \r by \n. So, the text output after  lexing can have a length which is different from the input. See: https://bitbucket.org/birkenfeld/pygments-main/src/e79a7126551c39d5f8c1b83a79c14e86992155a4/pygments/lexer.py?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#lexer.py-179

Assinging the following string in `prompt_toolkit.buffer` makes it crash. (Because, internally, prompt_toolkit doesn't consider \r to be a newline (it renders it as ^M), while Pygments does and returns more lines after lexing):

``` python
self.text = '(1, 2\r3,4)'
```

So, now I'm using `pygments.Lexer.get_tokens_unprocessed`, which doesn't do this replacement. After this patch, this would display as `(1, 2^M3,4)`.
https://github.com/jonathanslenders/python-prompt-toolkit/commit/3c2f68101d357848f9de3e9c95d7e6e35e9e4c51

Now the second problem is that inside a bracketed paste, I think we want to replace \r by \n. I have a pull request for this.
https://github.com/jonathanslenders/python-prompt-toolkit/compare/master...replace-r-in-bracketed-paste

Can you please test whether the latest master commit does solve the issue? (That should display ^M instead of a newline if everything works well.) And also test whether it is completely solved after merging this pull request?

Thanks!

(by the way, I'm travelling during the coming week, so I could be a bit unresponsive.)
